qas.question: When does most of Egypts rain fall?
Where does snow fall in Egypt?

answers.text: Sinai's mountains and some of the north coastal cities

qas.question: When was the last snow fall in Cairo?
What is the sunniest county in the world?

context: Most of Egypt's rain falls in the <a0_0>winter months<a0_0/>. South of Cairo, rainfall averages only around 2 to 5 mm (0.1 to 0.2 in) per year and at intervals of many years. On a very thin strip of the northern coast the rainfall can be as high as 410 mm (16.1 in), mostly between October and March. Snow falls on <a1_0>Sinai's mountains and some of the north coastal cities<a1_0/> such as Damietta, Baltim, Sidi Barrany, etc. and rarely in Alexandria. A very small amount of snow fell on Cairo on <a2_0>13 December 2013,<a2_0/> the first time Cairo received snowfall in many decades. Frost is also known in mid-Sinai and mid-Egypt. <a3_0>Egypt<a3_0/> is the driest and the sunniest country in the world, and most of its land surface is desert.
